sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"修理，修复"之意。
means: mend ： 通常指较简单的修复过程，一般不需要专门技术或特殊工具。
repair可与mend换用，但一般指需要较高的职业技能和使用较复杂的工具进行修理。
patch ： 通常指用类似材料修补破洞、裂缝或磨损的地方。
fix ： 多用于美语，仅用于指带有安装固定性质的修理。

sentence.Network_en: I wrote back to Meudon at once to fix up a meeting.
sentence.Network_cn: 我马上给缪顿回信安排会面。

sentence.Network_en: I need my fix of sugar, sweets, and chocolate.
sentence.Network_cn: 我离不开糖、甜品和巧克力。

sentence.Network_en: Fix your attention on the practicalities of financing your schemes.
sentence.Network_cn: 重点考虑为你的计划融资是否可行。

jx.jx_en_mean: determine the position of (something) by visual or radio bearings or astronomical observation
jx.jx_cn_mean: （以目测、无线电或天文观测方式来）确定…的方位

jx.jx_en_mean: To improve the appearance or condition of; refurbish.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 修理好，修补：改善…的状况或条件；刷新

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To provide a companion on a date for
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 给…安排同伴：约异性朋友出去玩时给…找一个同伴

lj.lj_ly: fixed me up with an escort at the last minute.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: partly from Old French fix 'fixed', partly from medieval Latin fixare 'to fix', both from Latin fixus, past participle of figere 'fix, fasten'. The noun dates from the early 19th cent

entry.def: If something is fixed somewhere, it is attached there firmly or securely.

example.ex: It is fixed on the wall...
example.tran: 它固定在墙上。

example.ex: Most blinds can be fixed directly to the top of the window-frame...
example.tran: 大多数窗帘都可直接安装在窗框上边。

entry.tran: 确定，决定，选定(日期、价格、政策等)
entry.def: If you fix something, for example a date, price, or policy, you decide and say exactly what it will be.

example.ex: He's going to fix a time when I can see him...
example.tran: 他会确定一个我和他会面的时间。

example.ex: The date of the election was fixed...
example.tran: 选举日期定下来了。

entry.def: If you fix something for someone, you arrange for it to happen or you organize it for them.

example.ex: I've fixed it for you to see Bonnie Lachlan...
example.tran: 你去见邦尼·拉克伦的事我已经安排好了。

example.ex: It's fixed. He's going to meet us at the airport...
example.tran: 已经安排好了，他会在机场接我们。

entry.def: If you fix something which is damaged or which does not work properly, you repair it.

example.ex: He cannot fix the electricity...
example.tran: 他不会修电路。

example.ex: If something is broken, we get it fixed.
example.tran: 如果什么东西坏了，我们就找人来修理。

entry.def: If you fix a problem or a bad situation, you deal with it and make it satisfactory.

example.ex: It's not too late to fix the problem, although time is clearly getting short...
example.tran: 虽然时间越来越紧迫，但现在处理这个问题还为时未晚。

example.ex: Fixing a 40-year-old wrong does not mean, however, that history can be undone.
example.tran: 但是，平反一件40年的冤案并不意味着历史可以重写。

entry.def: You can refer to a solution to a problem as a fix .

example.ex: Many of those changes could just be a temporary fix.
example.tran: 那些变革中可能有很多只是权宜之计。

entry.tran: (目光)专注于，凝视;目不转睛地看
entry.def: If you fix your eyes on someone or something or if your eyes fix on them, you look at them with complete attention.

example.ex: She fixes her steel-blue eyes on an unsuspecting local official...
example.tran: 她那灰蓝色的眼睛紧盯着一个毫无戒心的地方官员。

example.ex: Her soft brown eyes fixed on Kelly...
example.tran: 她那双温柔的棕色眼睛紧盯着凯利。

entry.def: If you fix someone with a particular kind of expression, you look at them in that way.

example.ex: He took her hand and fixed her with a look of deep concern...
example.tran: 他抓住她的手，表情极其关切地看着她。

example.ex: He fixed me with a lopsided grin.
example.tran: 他冲我歪嘴笑了笑。

entry.tran: 将(注意力)集中在;专心考虑
entry.def: If you fix your attention on someone or something, you think about them with complete attention.

example.ex: Fix your attention on the practicalities of financing your schemes...
example.tran: 重点考虑为你的计划融资是否可行。

example.ex: Attention is fixed on the stock market...
example.tran: 重点关注的是证券市场。

entry.tran: 牢记，铭记，镌刻(在头脑中)
entry.def: If someone or something is fixed in your mind, you remember them well, for example because they are very important, interesting, or unusual.

example.ex: Leonard was now fixed in his mind...
example.tran: 伦纳德现在已经令他无法忘怀。

example.ex: Amy watched the child's intent face eagerly, trying to fix it in her mind.
example.tran: 埃米急切地看着孩子那张神情专注的脸，想把它记在脑海里。

entry.tran: 把(枪、相机、雷达)对准(或瞄准、指向)
entry.def: If someone fixes a gun, camera, or radar on something, they point it at that thing.

example.ex: The US crew fixed its radar on the Turkish ship...
example.tran: 美国船员将雷达对准那艘土耳其船。

example.ex: The bore of the gun remained fixed on me.
example.tran: 枪口依然指着我。

entry.tran: (通常用雷达或电子设备)找到，弄清，确定(确切位置)
entry.def: If you fix the position of something, you find out exactly where it is, usually by using radar or electronic equipment.

example.ex: He had not been able to fix his position...
example.tran: 他一直未能确定他所在的位置。

example.ex: The satellite fixes positions by making repeated observations of each star.
example.tran: 卫星通过对每颗恒星反复观察进行定位。

entry.def: If you get a fix on someone or something, you have a clear idea or understanding of them.

example.ex: It's been hard to get a steady fix on what's going on.
example.tran: 要对正在发生的事情保持持续的关注和了解并不容易。

entry.def: If you fix some food or a drink for someone, you make it or prepare it for them.

example.ex: Sarah fixed some food for us...
example.tran: 萨拉为我们准备了一些吃的。

example.ex: Let me fix you a drink...
example.tran: 我给你弄杯饮料吧。

entry.tran: 整理，收拾(头发、衣服或妆容)
entry.def: If you fix your hair, clothes, or make-up, you arrange or adjust them so you look neat and tidy, showing you have taken care with your appearance.

example.ex: 'I've got to fix my hair,' I said and retreated to my bedroom...
example.tran: “我得把头发梳理一下，”我说罢回到了卧室。

example.ex: She called a cab, fixed her face, and scrawled a hasty note to Brian.
example.tran: 她叫了辆出租车，补了一下妆，匆匆地给布莱恩写了张便条。

entry.def: If you have your teeth fixed, you have treatment from a dentist to make your teeth even, straight, and white.

example.ex: The PR man suggested that I might benefit from getting my teeth fixed...
example.tran: 公关顾问建议说，整牙也许对我有好处。

example.ex: I wonder if Tom ever had his teeth fixed anywhere else.
example.tran: 我在想汤姆是不是在别的地方整过牙。

entry.tran: 在(比赛、竞选等活动中)作弊，做手脚，操纵
entry.def: If someone fixes a race, election, contest, or other event, they make unfair or illegal arrangements or use deception to affect the result.

example.ex: They offered opposing players bribes to fix a decisive league match against Valenciennes...
example.tran: 他们贿赂对方队员，在联赛对阵瓦朗谢讷队的一场决定性比赛中作弊。

example.ex: We didn't 'fix' anything. It'll be seen as it happens...
example.tran: 我们没做任何手脚，该什么样就会什么样。

entry.def: If you accuse someone of fixing prices, you accuse them of making unfair arrangements to charge a particular price for something, rather than allowing market forces to decide it.

example.ex: ...a suspected cartel that had fixed the price of steel for the construction market...
example.tran: 涉嫌操控建筑市场钢材价格的卡特尔

example.ex: The company is currently in dispute with the government over price fixing.
example.tran: 该公司目前与政府在是否存在价格操控问题上存在分歧。

entry.def: An injection of an addictive drug such as heroin can be referred to as a fix .

entry.tran: (维持身体或心理需要所需的)一个剂量，一定数量
entry.def: You can use fix to refer to an amount of something which a person gets or wants and which helps them physically or psychologically to survive.

example.ex: It turned the country into an 'aid junkie', heavily dependent on its annual fix of dollars...
example.tran: 这使得该国严重依赖每年救济的那点美元，成了“嗜援成瘾”的国家。

example.ex: I need my fix of sugar, sweets, and chocolate...
example.tran: 我离不开糖、甜品和巧克力。

entry.tran: (尤指由自己引起的)困境，窘境
entry.def: If you are in a fix, you are in a difficult situation, especially one that you have caused for yourself.

example.ex: He was in a fix...
example.tran: 他陷入了困境。

example.ex: The government has really got itself into a fix...
example.tran: 政府真的让自己陷入了困境。

entry.def: To fix something such as a dye or photographic image means to treat it with chemicals so that it does not lose its colour or disappear.

example.ex: Certain pigment colours were painted on to dry plaster using tempera (where egg yolk is used to fix the pigment)...
example.tran: 使用蛋彩画颜料(内含可以定色的蛋黄)在干石膏上绘出了特定颜色。

example.ex: The main aim of inbreeding is to standardise, to fix desirable inherited characteristics and to dispel undesirable ones.
example.tran: 同系交配的主要目的就是实现标准化，保持理想的遗传特性，并消除不良的特性。

entry.def: If you say that you will fix someone, you mean that you will stop their activities permanently.

example.ex: That'll fix him.
example.tran: 那样他就不会再干了。

entry.def: If you say that you are fixing to do something, you mean that you are planning or intending to do it.

example.ex: I'm fixing to go to graduate school...
example.tran: 我打算去读研究生。

example.ex: He would know when I was fixing to leave. He'd wait by the front door.
example.tran: 他会知道我打算什么时候走，他还会在前门等着。

entry.def: If you fix on a particular thing, you decide that it is the one you want and will have.

example.ex: The Vietnamese government has fixed on May 19th to celebrate his anniversary.
example.tran: 越南政府已经决定于5月19日庆祝他的诞辰。

entry.def: If you fix something up, you arrange it.

example.ex: I fixed up an appointment to see her...
example.tran: 我安排了与她见面。

example.ex: Accommodation is never fixed up in advance.
example.tran: 住宿从未提前安排好。

entry.def: If you fix something up, you do work that is necessary in order to make it more suitable or attractive.

example.ex: I've fixed up Matthew's old room...
example.tran: 我已经把马修原来住的房间装饰了一番。

example.ex: The whole block is being fixed up.
example.tran: 整个街区都在进行装修。

entry.def: If you fix someone up with something they need, you provide it for them.

example.ex: We'll fix him up with a tie...
example.tran: 我们将给他准备一条领带。

example.ex: He was fixed up with a job.
example.tran: 别人给他找了一份工作。

means.word_mean: 1. informal terms for a difficult situation;

sentences.sentence: "he made a muddle of his marriage"

means.word_mean: 2. something craved, especially an intravenous injection of a narcotic drug;
3. the act of putting something in working order again
4. an exemption granted after influence (e.g., money) is brought to bear;

sentences.sentence: "collusion resulted in tax fixes for gamblers"

means.word_mean: 5. a determination of the location of something;

sentences.sentence: "he got a good fix on the target"

means.word_mean: 1. restore by replacing a part or putting together what is torn or broken;

sentences.sentence: "she fixed her gaze on the man"

means.word_mean: 4. prepare for eating by applying heat;
5. take vengeance on or get even;

sentences.sentence: "Let's fix the date for the party!"

means.word_mean: 7. kill, preserve, and harden (tissue) in order to prepare for microscopic study

sentences.sentence: "let's fix the picture to the frame"
"in some countries, people with genetically transmissible disbilites are sterilized"
"She posited her hand on his shoulder"

means.word_mean: 11. make ready or suitable or equip in advance for a particular purpose or for some use, event, etc;

sentences.sentence: "I was fixing to leave town after I paid the hotel bill"

auth_sentence.content: I have a solution that can fix this problem.
auth_sentence.res_content: I have a solution that can fix this problem.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I have a solution that can fix this problem.

auth_sentence.content: Don't fix the symptom; address the cause.
auth_sentence.res_content: Don't fix the symptom; address the cause.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Don't fix the symptom; address the cause.

auth_sentence.content: We cannot fix a tribal society with democracy.
auth_sentence.res_content: We cannot fix a tribal society with democracy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We cannot fix a tribal society with democracy.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 固定设备;预定日期;比赛时间;定期存款
stems_affixes.word_buile: fix固定+ture表名词→n.固定设备;预定日期;比赛时间;定期存款
pre前+fix固定→固定在前面→前缀
suf后+fix固定→在后面固定→后缀

abbreviation.mean_cn: 固定设备，预定日期，比赛时间，装置器，工作夹具

Sentence.sentence: It must have taken you a long time to fix up all these book shelves.
Doris fixed up some of the bookshelves.
They haven't fixed all the shortcomings of print books.
Young people grow up without developing the skills to fix things around the house," says Richard Curtin, director of the Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers.
To ask him to fix the dictating machine
But some of their fixes have made the problem worse.

sentences.en: They know how to fix their cars.
sentences.cn: 他们知道怎样修理自己的汽车。

means.word_mean: 安排; 决定, 确定

sentences.en: I will fix the same room for you.
sentences.cn: 我会给你安排同样的房间。

sentences.en: Let me fix you a drink!
sentences.cn: 让我来给你们准备一点饮料吧！

means.word_mean: 使牢固，使稳固，使固定；扎牢，钉牢，系紧

sentences.en: We fixed a picture on the wall.
He got himself into a bad fix.
We got a fix on the missile launching site.
sentences.cn: 我们确定了导弹发射场的位置。
这次选举是受人操纵的！

jushi.english: He fixed it firmly in the memory.
He is well fixed by beer.
jushi.chinese: 他由于喝了啤酒,情绪很好。

jushi.english: Justice has prevailed; the guilty man has been fixed.
jushi.chinese: 正义得到伸张,罪犯受到惩罚。
